background: The company aims to minimize costs while managing different categories of requirements, each with varying strengths, costs associated with waste, and number of recruits.
constraints: The company can have up to NumOverman over-managed categories, with each incurring a cost of CostOverman
The company can have up to NumShortwork short-work categories, with each incurring a cost of CostShort
Over-managed and short-work categories must be within their respective allowable limits
objective: Minimize the overall costs of operations under the given conditions
description: The company’s declared objective is to minimize costs. It has \param{K} categories of requirements, with each category consisting of \param{I} different requirements. The strength of each requirement category is denoted by \param{Strength}, whereas the cost reductions per unit less waste in each category and the additional costs per unit more waste in each category are represented by \param{LessOneWaste} and \param{MoreOneWaste}, respectively. The number of recruits in each category is given by \param{Recruit}, and the cost of redundancy per recruit in each category is \param{CostRedundancy}. The company can allow \param{NumOverman} over-managed categories, with each over-managed category incurring a cost of \param{CostOverman}. Similarly, \param{NumShortwork} short-work categories are permissible, each one resulting in a cost of \param{CostShort}. How should they operate in order to minimize these costs?

parameters.definition: Cost reduction per unit less waste in each category
Additional cost per unit more waste in each category
Number of recruits in each category
Cost of redundancy per recruit in each category
Cost of over-managing in each category
Cost of short-work in each category
